newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait sell-off plan said to be worth $12 billion.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait sell-off plan said to be worth $12 billion.

text.p: Kuwait's privatisation plan involves the sale of public services and state holdings outside the oil sector worth 3.622 billion dinars ($12 billion), a newspaper reported on Tuesday.
"State ownership in firms and sectors that are candidates for privatisation, apart from the oil sector, is estimated at 3.622 billion dinars," al-Qabas newspaper said.

The daily estimated the value of the electricity and water sector at 2.2 billion dinars, telecommunications at 200 million and Kuwait Airways Corp at 422 million dinars. The state's holdings in 62 local firms was put at 800 million.

Officials earlier said that since September 1994 the state had sold shares worth over 700 million dinars in more than 20 local firms under the first phase of the privatisation programme which will involve another 35 companies.

The government has sent to parliament a draft law to move to the next and more controversial stage of privatising heavily- subsidised utility firms which are often used to provide employment for Kuwaitis.
